text: It 's a nice color
and has effectively protected my macbook .
However , I 've been
trying to remove it to clean my computer
and it 's really difficult for it to come off .
I was only able to remove the bottom .
Heads up !
I purchased this case
because it looked very functional ...
To my surprise the rivets popped out and the zipper broke about two weeks into it 's use .
I have never been disappointed by a Sampsonite product until now .
I have written to them
and received no communication in return !
This case is awful .
The bottom has no way
of staying on .
Its ridiculous ...
The styrofoam feet are going to fall off instantly .
The material
it is made of seems
like it would make a good case ,
but I really do n't understand
why there is no way the make
the bottom part " snap " on .
Extremely disappointed ...
This laptop case from Case Logic is nice for a non-fancy leathery kind .
It is a 13-14 inch case , sadly a little too small for my Toshiba .
My Dell would be fine in it , though .
It has sufficient pockets and nice padding for the laptop compartment .
It is black and gray with lime green .
The handle is adjustable
and I think
it would do well in the rain ,
as it seems
the rain would roll right off of it .
Overall , a nice well-made product for its level .
This case looks and feels great ,
but is not too good for protection .
My laptop usually just sits on my desk ,
which is great for this case , but the first time
I decided to take my laptop with me ,
and placed it in a sleeve inside my backpack ,
the case
developed cracks all over
and part of it chipped off .
But at 1/4 the price of the Speck cases
that I also have ,
I guess
you get
what you pay for .
Update :
after less than six months , all of the rubber feet fell off
and the bottom piece cracked to the point
that it no longer would stay on .
Went back to a Speck case about a month ago
and could n't be happier .
The messenger bag has a place for every thing
and for the price it is a great value .
I hope the handles wear well
but I would feel this about any product
made of the same material .
The bag closes up very nice and is not baggie or sloppy looking ,
it has good form ,
that 's important to me .
The function of the bag and its clean lines are well thought out .
Over all a really good purchases .
The sleeve gives a good protection
and looks rugged enough
to be used in backpacks or suitcases .
It 's light padded
but I did n't expect a huge protection from shocks or hits by this kind of sleeves .
The downside
-LRB- that costed two stars to this review -RRB-
is
that there are two small handles with metallic fastener
that are normally
stowed inside the sleeve .
The fasteners are in direct contact with the laptop
so they might end up
scratching it .
The good :
Thin but well padded , inexpensive ,
and good
looking sleeve .
I loved it
when I first opened it .
My Lenovo Yoga 2 Pro was slightly loose , but still secure in it .
I chose this sleeve over the other for the possibility
of sticking the power cord into the side pocket in a rush situation .
The bad and the ugly .
As soon as I put my laptop in the sleeve , I noticed
that the sleeve has hidden on the inside two loops
that can be pulled out
and used
to carry the the case with your hands .
Neat idea , except that those two loops are attached to the inside of the case with two thick metallic buttons .
And guess what ,
as you slide your laptop in and out of the sleeve ,
they rub against the exterior of the laptop regularly ,
making it ripe for scratches and marks .
Just what I needed for my delicate ultrabook .
Thankfully Amazon has easy returns and this one is going back for sure !
I just bought an Acer Aspire TimelineX 13 '' ,
and the laptop fits perfect there .
The case design is the most comfortable
that I 've had .
It 's compact , padded everywhere and with a lot of compartments .
The mesh pocket is very useful for the laptop 's large power brick .
The only downside is that before 2 weeks of very mild use
-LRB- and only used it to transport the laptop one time from NY to Boston and back -RRB-
and one of the corners already got ripped .
Looks like
they 're not very durable .
I 'm
including a pic .
I was really excited to get this backpack
because I had been carefully searching for a backpack
that had to fit my 17 inch laptop .
I received my SwissGear backpack
and really loved all of the pockets , padded straps ,
all the compartments
it had
and the durability of the fabric and the price was right .
In the stores , this backpack would have been at least double the price .
But ,
when I tried to fit my laptop in the compartment
it was supposed to go in ,
it did n't fit .
I was really disappointed
because everything else about this backpack was really nice .
I was able to fit it in another compartment
which fits snug ,
but it does n't have the padding or strap
that is supposed
to hold it in place .
I did decide to just keep the backpack
because of all of it 's other features and other uses
I have for it and it 's ability
to hold my laptop in another compartment .
I was happy with this bag early on . . seemingly well padded , lots of space and pockets , and an attractive design for a reasonable price .
However , after less than 2 weeks of use , the strap
detached from one side as I
was walking down the sidewalk .
The bag swung down
and hit the pavement on one corner ,
denting in the corner of my laptop .
Now , I did have a laptop , battery , and a few notebooks/books in the bag ,
but I did n't feel
that it was significantly overloaded or heavy .
Upon closer examination , it appeared
that the sewing/seam
attaching the strap to the bag
is minimal , and probably not very durable
-LRB- the strap on the other side was also halfway torn out -RRB- .
I was also disappointed
the padding underneath was not very effective in protecting my laptop .
Overall , its a pretty nice-looking bag , but the seams
where the strap attaches to the bag are one pretty significant flaw ... just not a durable design .
If you do decide to purchase this bag ,
be sure to keep
it loaded very lightly .
This case is a gorgeous , bright green color .
It 's not the most well made , and the last time
I bought it
it developed a few cracks after a month or two of use .
There were a couple sharp areas of plastic
I had to file down .
However , I bought the case again
when my old one wore out
-LRB- about 7 months after I bought it -RRB-
because it 's cheap
and does
what I want it to for the price .
Plus , a lot of the more expensive cases are n't as bright as this one .
This is a nice neoprene sleeve for my MacBook Air .
The fit is perfect
and it gives a nice amount of padding .
It probably wo n't protect my laptop from a fall ,
but it 's great for day-to-day protection
while my laptop is either at my home or tucked inside my briefcase .
My only complaint is the interior color -
the black case has a BRIGHT lime green interior .
I do n't care for it ,
but no one really sees it .
Overall , a good value .
Functionality wise : awesome !
Has room for a lot of stuff ,
and keeps the computer really protected ,
and that 's the most important feature a case
like that can have .
Does n't look shiny and fancy , though ,
and it 's something
I look
for in everything I buy .
But it varies from a person to another , obviously .
Anyway I recommend .
The case itself looks pretty high quality ,
but it 's too thin .
Getting the laptop in and out of the case is a huge hassle
requiring both hands and lots
of pulling .
I have a 15 . 4 '' Widescreen Dell Dimensions 1501 .
It fits in there snug ,
but as I stated above , getting the computer in and out is pain
-LRB- my wife is trying to convince me to return it ,
but I 'm too lazy ,
I think
we 'll just keep it -RRB- .
Also ,
if you have a wireless mouse ,
it bulges out .
Again , it has to do with the case
being so thin .
To some this characteristic may be very desirable
because the case is very low profile ,
but
if you have perfiferals like a wireless mouse or a A/C adapter
that is more than an inch thick ,
it bulges out .
There 's padding , of course ,
so your periferals probably will not be damaged ...
it just looks kinda funny .
Not much to say about this ,
it 's a fairly basic neoprene sleeve .
It has nice construction for $ 12 .
Steel zipper glides are kept away from scratching your laptop by internal gussets of neoprene .
The external pocket is fairly big .
Mine is black on the outside and lime green inside , an attractive combination .
The sleeve is slightly too big for a new 13 " Macbook Pro .
While it 's not exactly a " custom fit " ,
it works fine .
No reason to spend any more than this .
I bought this case with the intent
that it would protect my computer .
It did the complete opposite ,
and now the paint on the front part of my computer has worn off in two spots .
The front zipper
where the charger is placed
-LRB- as pictured in the photo -RRB- ,
wore a hole through the padding ,
and started to scratch my computer .
Avoid this case .
I am fussy about everything .
I love this cover .
It clips on easily ,
the color is gorgeous Tiffany blue/green ,
it has a nice satin outer and hard inner side .
The apple lite shows through
if that is a concern for you .
I got this from TopCase in record time .
It arrived two days
after I ordered it
and was in excellent condition .
My 15 . 6 '' HP Pavilion dv6-1360US
barely fit inside the protective slot for laptop in this bag !
When I put my laptop in the protective slot ,
the laptop get very close to the zipper ,
and the laptop pushes against the top of the bag
-LRB- I can see laptop corners through the bag -RRB- .
I have to be VERY careful to zip it to make sure
that the zipper does not scratch my laptop .
I am a little worried
about carrying weight in the bag
because it will press against the laptop .
The bag does have a bigger space by the protective slot .
It is big enough for my laptop ,
but does not have any cushion on the sides
-LRB- there is a little cushion at the bottom -RRB- .
I may put my laptop here
by adding some cushion
if I feel too uncomfortable
about putting my laptop in the protective slot .
Other than this , the bag appears to be rugged and well made .
We initially had trouble
unzipping the bag
because some zipper teeth were not aligned .
But
after we pushed them in ,
it works fine .
As other reviewers noticed ,
the mp3 slot is inside the bag .
Do n't know how useful that it .
First time I have
been dissappointed with a product from Amazon .
Appearantly others are
having the same problem with a 17 '' laptop not fitting in the compartment .
My laptop is a standard size in the market .
The bag may look good
but that does n't help if laptop does n't fit .
Totally dissappointed with SwissGear and Amazon .
This is a well constructed product
made of quality materials .
The color is a true red
as I thought
it would be
and not a hot pink as it appears in the ad .
I have read a lot of different opinions
about what size laptop fits in it .
I have a Sony Vaio
that measures 15?1/8 inches long
and it fits nicely .
I 'm not sure
that it would fit
if it were much longer .
It has many pockets for just about anything
you might want to carry
while traveling .
Not sure
why I had to pay more for it than the blue or black ?
I bought
this case for Dell Inspiron E1505
screen .
It was way too small .
This case has an inner pocket ,
which is the actual spot for the laptop
to slip in .
I will say
it can only fit a 14 '' screen .
I ended up
putting my laptop outside the inner pocket ,
which barely fit .
I wish
the manufacturer noticed this problem and not listed for any 15 '' + screens .
Very happy with the Samsonite L35 Notebook Case .
Fits my MacBook with plenty of room .
Lots of pokets for my mouse , mouse pad , and accessories .
Just the right size
for what I wanted .
Nice looking , and well built .
Like a dummy I ordered it after reading
that it does n't fit some of the 17 '' models .
I have an HP
and it doesnt fit .
On the plus side it does have a lot of nooks and crannies to put stuff in .
Just disappointed to find out my laptop does n't fit .
Need to leave it unzipped .
Just build it a tad bit bigger
and send my one for my idea .
You 'll have the best on the market !
Nice try ` eh
I want to be clear ,
the vendor
that I purchased this hunk of junk from stood up for it
and supplied a perfect replacement at no extra charge .
As far as the Case Logic bag
though I was severely disappointed .
I researched for a long time to find what I thougt
would be a good bag for my needs .
This bag was it
until I received it .
It came in with a defective zipper
and I tried twice to contact the manufacturer Case Logic ,
and they never even responded .
This from a consumer standpoint really turned me off from even considering a Case Logic in the future .
I will also never recommend their product to anyone .
I will however say the Samsonite replacement
that the vendor sent
me was great
and it worked really well on my trip .
Quality was the factor
and the zippers on the Case Logic were substandard ,
so be careful
when considering their product .
